required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Dietary Intervention for Obese Pregnant Women - a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this rct -study is to explore the effect of a dietary intervention for overweight (body maas index BMI≥25) and obese (BMI≥30) pregnant women on gestational weight gain and the prevalence of gestational diabetes.

detailed_description.textblock: Pregnant women are recruited for the study from 18 maternity care clinics in Northern Savo and Northern Karelia area. The participants will be randomized into intervention and control groups. All the participants will have access to the study web-pages, which includes written material of healthy diet during pregnancy as well as all the study material (4 day food records, Three factor eating questionnaire (TFEQ R-18) and Binge Eating Scale (BES)). In addition, intervention group will get two virtual dietary counseling sessions by a dietician. The information on participants' gestational weight gain and the result of oral glucose tolerance tests will be collected by the public health nurses after birth.

primary_outcome.description: gestational weight gain (from pre-pregnancy weight until childbirth), measured at maternity care clinic.

secondary_outcome.description: GDM is measured by the result of an oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the intervention up to gestational weeks 36-37
secondary_outcome.description: eating habits are measured by 4 day food records

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the intervention up to gestational weeks 37-42
secondary_outcome.description: Eating habits are measured by TFEQ R-18 questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the intervention up to gestational weeks 37-42
secondary_outcome.description: Eating habits are measured by Binge Eating Scale (BES)

arm_group.description: Dietary intervention: Written material on healthy diet during pregnancy, 2 virtual dietary counseling sessions given by a dietician. Otherwise basic care and counseling at maternity care clinics.
Written material on healthy diet during pregnancy, otherwise basic care and counseling at maternity care clinics.

intervention.description: Written material on healthy diet during pregnancy and 2 virtual dietary counseling sessions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI 25 or higher
- healthy, no chronic medical conditions that can prevent participating to the study
- singleton pregnancy
- first trimester of pregnancy at the time of recruitment
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI less than 25
- chronic medical conditions
- multiple pregnancy
- pregnancy at second or third trimester at the time of recruitment
